slides.title: Hello, and welcome to Burning Stories!
slides.subtitle: Welcome to the Burning Stories research unit - an experiment in understanding creative and participatory leadership
slides.body: The aim of Burning Stories is to study the global Burning Man community. We seek to explain the processes through which community membership evolves across time and space, and how this, in turn, affects their experience of the collective identity. There is a very limited understanding of how its immersive experiences transform individuals, let alone society. That is precisely what we aim to find out with this project.

slides.title: Ready?
slides.body: What was it that brought you here? What do you really care about right now? You are somehow connected to the global 'burner' culture, either as a researcher of it, a leader in it or a co-creator of it. What are the experiences that keep pulling you back into it?
Think back on the last 12 months. Did you go to any 'burns'? What were the themes for you?
What are you curious to learn from studying Burning Man and other burn events and their cultures?
Imagine Burning Man in ten years. What does it look like?

slides.title: The last little bit!
slides.body: These questions will be used to register an account for you on our forum. where you can go back and update your answers.
